I would feel that way too.</s><s>It' s been really rough. I' ve tried so hard to be there for her, and I feel like she just doesn' t even appreciate it.</s><s>I don' t think she is a place to be able to see anyone but herself. [CLS] <s>Do you think the anger you are feeling is directly a result of the situation? Do you feel the anger is manifested from somewhere else? I think it is important to get to the underlying source of the anger and take care of that first and foremost. That' s concerning, but very understandable. Are you able to financially seek additional help? Sometimes it' s just what you need, as hard or embarrassing as that may seem. No one needs to know what you seek, but it is important not to disregard additional help, be it mental health, physical therapy, or just general prevention and detection from a PCP.</s><s>I feel that I am having trouble dealing with the fact that I am not able to do all the things I want to do. It is not an easy thing to lose your abilities when you feel so young but your body says otherwise. I was in physical therapy but could not afford it any longer. So instead I purchased my own hot tub to be able to soak in and do some water exercises that may help me.</s><s>I think that' s a normal way to feel and a frustrating part of growing older. [CLS] <s>Hello.</s><s>Hi, how are you?</s><s>Good thanks, so what' s troubling you?</s><s>I' m so mad at my boyfriend for not taking any responsibility. I' m about to break up with him.</s><s>Responsibility in regards to what? Like in what area of life do you mean?</s><s>We' ve been dating 4 years, meeting in high school. Now we' re graduated and I' ve gone to college. He doesn' t have a job yet after 1 year.</s><s>Hmm, has he been looking for work, or just laying around playing video games and shit like that?</s><s>I' ve been away at college and just came home on break so I' m not sure. He tells me he is looking but I don' t know how it' s taking a year to get a job.</s><s>Well, I suppose it' s possible that he' s been earnestly looking and just not having any luck. Is he kind of a loser in general, or is he a stand - up guy?</s><s>He got average grades in school but didn' t really miss days from school..</s><s>Ok, so it sounds like you' re kind of fed up with him in general, and not having a job is maybe just a part of the bigger issue?</s><s>That' s probably correct. He hasn' t been in contact with me as much since I left for school. I just expected more.</s><s>Well, it sounds like you' re both in kind of a transitional period in life. It' s pretty normal for relationships to not necessarily survive through things like this.</s><s>That' s so sad since we have so many years together, but I feel like I' m moving forward and he is staying in place.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Yeah, I mean it' s never easy going through a breakup, but people change as they get older and mature, and they aren' t necessarily going to still be compatible the whole time. Also I think it' s important to not think of a relationship that peters out as a failed one. Just because it didn' t last until one of you died doesn' t mean it wasn' t a success. I think people put too much emphasis on permanence.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Yeah, I mean it' s never easy going through a breakup, but people change as they get older and mature, and they aren' t necessarily going to still be compatible the whole time. Also I think it' s important to not think of a relationship that peters out as a failed one. Just because it didn' t last until one of you died doesn' t mean it wasn' t a success. I think people put too much emphasis on permanence.</s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s>

I would feel that way too.</s><s>It' s been really rough. I' ve tried so hard to be there for her, and I feel like she just doesn' t even appreciate it.</s><s>I don' t think she is a place to be able to see anyone but herself. [CLS] <s>Do you think the anger you are feeling is directly a result of the situation? Do you feel the anger is manifested from somewhere else? I think it is important to get to the underlying source of the anger and take care of that first and foremost. That' s concerning, but very understandable. Are you able to financially seek additional help? Sometimes it' s just what you need, as hard or embarrassing as that may seem. No one needs to know what you seek, but it is important not to disregard additional help, be it mental health, physical therapy, or just general prevention and detection from a PCP.</s><s>I feel that I am having trouble dealing with the fact that I am not able to do all the things I want to do. It is not an easy thing to lose your abilities when you feel so young but your body says otherwise. I was in physical therapy but could not afford it any longer. So instead I purchased my own hot tub to be able to soak in and do some water exercises that may help me.</s><s>I think that' s a normal way to feel and a frustrating part of growing older. [CLS] <s>Hello.</s><s>Hi, how are you?</s><s>Good thanks, so what' s troubling you?</s><s>I' m so mad at my boyfriend for not taking any responsibility. I' m about to break up with him.</s><s>Responsibility in regards to what? Like in what area of life do you mean?</s><s>We' ve been dating 4 years, meeting in high school. Now we' re graduated and I' ve gone to college. He doesn' t have a job yet after 1 year.</s><s>Hmm, has he been looking for work, or just laying around playing video games and shit like that?</s><s>I' ve been away at college and just came home on break so I' m not sure. He tells me he is looking but I don' t know how it' s taking a year to get a job.</s><s>Well, I suppose it' s possible that he' s been earnestly looking and just not having any luck. Is he kind of a loser in general, or is he a stand - up guy?</s><s>He got average grades in school but didn' t really miss days from school..</s><s>Ok, so it sounds like you' re kind of fed up with him in general, and not having a job is maybe just a part of the bigger issue?</s><s>That' s probably correct. He hasn' t been in contact with me as much since I left for school. I just expected more.</s><s>Well, it sounds like you' re both in kind of a transitional period in life. It' s pretty normal for relationships to not necessarily survive through things like this.</s><s>That' s so sad since we have so many years together, but I feel like I' m moving forward and he is staying in place.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Yeah, I mean it' s never easy going through a breakup, but people change as they get older and mature, and they aren' t necessarily going to still be compatible the whole time. Also I think it' s important to not think of a relationship that peters out as a failed one. Just because it didn' t last until one of you died doesn' t mean it wasn' t a success. I think people put too much emphasis on permanence.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Yeah, I mean it' s never easy going through a breakup, but people change as they get older and mature, and they aren' t necessarily going to still be compatible the whole time. Also I think it' s important to not think of a relationship that peters out as a failed one. Just because it didn' t last until one of you died doesn' t mean it wasn' t a success. I think people put too much emphasis on permanence.</s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s>

I would feel that way too.</s><s>It' s been really rough. I' ve tried so hard to be there for her, and I feel like she just doesn' t even appreciate it.</s><s>I don' t think she is a place to be able to see anyone but herself. [CLS] <s>Do you think the anger you are feeling is directly a result of the situation? Do you feel the anger is manifested from somewhere else? I think it is important to get to the underlying source of the anger and take care of that first and foremost. That' s concerning, but very understandable. Are you able to financially seek additional help? Sometimes it' s just what you need, as hard or embarrassing as that may seem. No one needs to know what you seek, but it is important not to disregard additional help, be it mental health, physical therapy, or just general prevention and detection from a PCP.</s><s>I feel that I am having trouble dealing with the fact that I am not able to do all the things I want to do. It is not an easy thing to lose your abilities when you feel so young but your body says otherwise. I was in physical therapy but could not afford it any longer. So instead I purchased my own hot tub to be able to soak in and do some water exercises that may help me.</s><s>I think that' s a normal way to feel and a frustrating part of growing older. [CLS] <s>Hello.</s><s>Hi, how are you?</s><s>Good thanks, so what' s troubling you?</s><s>I' m so mad at my boyfriend for not taking any responsibility. I' m about to break up with him.</s><s>Responsibility in regards to what? Like in what area of life do you mean?</s><s>We' ve been dating 4 years, meeting in high school. Now we' re graduated and I' ve gone to college. He doesn' t have a job yet after 1 year.</s><s>Hmm, has he been looking for work, or just laying around playing video games and shit like that?</s><s>I' ve been away at college and just came home on break so I' m not sure. He tells me he is looking but I don' t know how it' s taking a year to get a job.</s><s>Well, I suppose it' s possible that he' s been earnestly looking and just not having any luck. Is he kind of a loser in general, or is he a stand - up guy?</s><s>He got average grades in school but didn' t really miss days from school..</s><s>Ok, so it sounds like you' re kind of fed up with him in general, and not having a job is maybe just a part of the bigger issue?</s><s>That' s probably correct. He hasn' t been in contact with me as much since I left for school. I just expected more.</s><s>Well, it sounds like you' re both in kind of a transitional period in life. It' s pretty normal for relationships to not necessarily survive through things like this.</s><s>That' s so sad since we have so many years together, but I feel like I' m moving forward and he is staying in place.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Yeah, I mean it' s never easy going through a breakup, but people change as they get older and mature, and they aren' t necessarily going to still be compatible the whole time. Also I think it' s important to not think of a relationship that peters out as a failed one. Just because it didn' t last until one of you died doesn' t mean it wasn' t a success. I think people put too much emphasis on permanence.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Yeah, I mean it' s never easy going through a breakup, but people change as they get older and mature, and they aren' t necessarily going to still be compatible the whole time. Also I think it' s important to not think of a relationship that peters out as a failed one. Just because it didn' t last until one of you died doesn' t mean it wasn' t a success. I think people put too much emphasis on permanence.</s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s>

[CLS]  ve been feeling really depressed and lethargic lately. the holidays feel like all work and no joy this year... it is hard being away from family.</s><s>Can you explain to me more in depth what events are making you feel this way?</s><s>the fact that there is a pandemic and travel is restricted, normally i would spend the holidays with my family but i will be alone this year. there is still a lot of work to do but it feels like there is nothing to look forward to.</s><s>I understand exactly how you feel since I am also unable to go fly out to see my family this Christmas. It sounds like you are very overwhelmed with the amount of work you have and having no break, correct?</s><s>it has been such a long year, i am just ready for things to improve. it is hard not having the usual coping mechanisms of socializing with friends or going out. yes, that is part of it. the work wouldn' t seem so bad if there was somethign to look forward to but every day feels the same.</s><s>When I start to feel alone and missing my family or friends, I usually like the plan a skype or group facetime session right after I get off of work.</s><s>i have tried to use zoom and facetime but video chat gives me anxiety.</s><s>There are online resources to have some fun with friends too - - many blogs suggest hosting a group game night or a shared movie night.</s><s>that does sound a little better. the winter makes it worse too, all the days are so dark and cold.</s><s>I am sure with a bit of trial and error, hosting a movie or game night would be a breeze for you too!</s><s>i wish that i could spend more time outside, over the summer and fall it helped to get more fresh air and exercise.</s><s>Having this winter sadness, especially around holiday times, may be a sign of seasonal depression.</s><s>i do usually experience depression in the winter and around the holidays. but the pandemic has made it harder to cope.</s><s>I have had seasonal depression in the past, and going on nature hikes and bike rides has helped me a lot. Maybe spending less time inside your home and grabbing some fresh air can relieve some of that anxiety and stress.</s><s>it hasn' t been too cold to go out... now that the days will start getting longer maybe there will be more time to get outside.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Research shows that physical activity greatly reduces stress! It sounds like going out more would be very beneficial to you!</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>

[CLS] <s>Hello.</s><s>Hello, how are you doing?</s><s>I have been better. I am really stressed and feel like I am at a breaking point..</s><s>I am sorry to hear you are near your breaking point, do you have any idea when the decline and stress began?</s><s>It began a few weeks ago. I have had a really intense project that is on a time crunch. I feel like I am overwhelmed and unable to balance work and personal life.</s><s>Work and personal life are very hard to juggle with each other, especially in the current life situations around the globe. I am sure you will successfully handle both in the overall.</s><s>What should I do to help feel like I can manage and push through? Right no w i feel like giving up.</s><s>For me, when I start getting overwhelmed and need to" debrief" my mind, and" declutter" the stresses, I use a notepad. I jot down every detail I can that pops into mind. Every upcoming task, everything that has caused anxiety or similar, and then I prioritize them in an agenda. It seems tedious, however once you get a handle on scheduling, in my personal ex perience, it is easier to hold yourself accountable and slowly work your way through accomplishments, even small tasks, which is encouraging to continue. Sometimes, something as small as an accomplished task can uplift a mood greatly. Especially when listed and checked off to see the progress.</s><s>Thank you. That seems helpful. I tend to make excuses for myself when I feel like this and allow myself to slip in other areas of my life. For example if I am stressed, I tend to eat unhealthy food. Overall its hard to juggle all things I want to do and be at once. I will plan to make a list and check off some small things..</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>

[CLS] <s>Yes I can understand that. Sadness and depresion can lead one to feel depleted and lacking motivation to make change.. Now that it is spring time though hopefully that changes.</s><s>Lets hope the new manager improves things for you, it sounds like there is a ray of hope there! [CLS] <s>Hello.</s><s>Hello! How are you doing today?.</s><s>I' m not doing very well unfortunately. <s>Okay gotcha. Well a couple tips I can offer you: If you do end up on probation, most courses offer a probation workshop you can go through. And if you graduate in June, it should finish in time for you! And I was also going to recommend taking fewer units. As much as it sucks, you can' t overwhelm yourself with work. You need to be able to have a healthy and happy life that is separate from school in order to preform your best. Dropping your minor may be what is best for not only your grades, but your mental health. I also recommend making an educational plan. Although it can seem scary and long to see your goals directly laid out in front of you, it really helps with motivation.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Okay gotcha. Well a couple tips I can offer you: If you do end up on probation, most courses offer a probation workshop you can go through. And if you graduate in June, it should finish in time for you! And I was also going to recommend taking fewer units. As much as it sucks, you can' t overwhelm yourself with work. You need to be able to have a healthy and happy life that is separate from school in order to preform your best. Dropping your minor may be what is best for not only your grades, but your mental health. I also recommend making an educational plan. Although it can seem scary and long to see your goals directly laid out in front of you, it really helps with motivation.</s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s>

[CLS] <s>I am a software developer due to covid - 19 I lost my job. do you refer me with your friends and collegeues.</s><s>Since you are a software developer, isn' t there a possibility for you to work from home? <s>Self care is so important even when there isn' t a pandemic. It can help you connect with yourself and make you feel less overwhelmed and just give you YOU time. [CLS] <s>It sounds like you have a full plate with the little one. I know a lot of people are fearful now, but rest assured, children are really resilient to disease. The CDC has not even one record of a healthy child dying. Can you still go to the park and let them run and play? I think it' s healthier to be around people then to isolate. That' s my personal observation. It' s really taking a toll on all of us emotionally to be distant. little ones...</s><s>For a few months I eased up and let them play at the park, but we live in MI which is having another huge spike, especially our county. Thank goodness we have a pretty large yard for them to run and play in but I also know its not the same.</s><s>One thing that comes to mind about your marriage is how I continued to work on myself, and surprisingly, some of the changes I made in myself helped my husband change. For example. I realized I didn' t speak respectfully to him all the time. So I changed my tone. Sometimes I didn' t FEEL respectful, but I read this book explaining how men really need that. So I changed me. And you know what, he really responded well to that. Became more kind and loving. I prayed a lot and that is one thing God showed me. I read a few books on what men were like and how I could help my marriage. My husband often oblivious, but when I worked on me and doing things that men like, he actually became a better man. Hard to explain. I would encourage you to write out some goals and things you want to change about yourself, ideas for you and your children to do. And fight the blues as hard as you can. I find that if I have a list of things I need to do, I can follow that even when I don' t feel like it, and sometimes I get out of the slump.</s><s>It makes total sense. I have tried to do some research and yes work on myself as well. I have done a ton of praying. I do need to make new goals. They help me stay on track, thats for sure. <s>It sounds like you do know good things to do, and that sometimes you need that encouragement and and support. Do you have friends maybe to check in with? Just to chat. It upsets us then we don' t know what to do, we fall down and get in a slump. And I find that writing lists, making goals, calling friends, doing things differently, brainstorming solutions can help me get back on track.</s>

I was prescribed to a med to help but I dont think its fully in its works yet.</s><s>Antidepressants can take a couple of weeks to kick in, I am on them too; I hope you will find them helpful. It' s hard waiting for them to work! Do you have someone helping you with the baby or are you a single mom? The best advice I can share from my experience as a new mom was find someone to give you breaks. Whether that be a partner, a friend, a family member, or even a baby sitter if that' s possible. Its important to take time to rest and recharge an nurture yourself, whether that be a nap, a bubble bath, a walk or whatever has made you feel good in the past.</s><s>Thank you, I hope so too. IT' s going to sound quite dramatic, but I regret breaking up with this person. I feel as though they were my soulmate. And I ruined it.</s><s>Oh... I see, you think s/ he' s the" one who got away?" Why did you break up?</s><s>Pretty much... but the dumb thing about that is I am the one who broke it off. I was with him since beginning of high school, and so I never knew anything other than him. [CLS]'m really depressed. I just found out my buddy of 20 years is now posting that he believes Trump and that the election is being stolen from him. I thought I knew him but now I don' t know.</s><s>That' s a really tough thing to deal with. <s>Yeah, I mean it' s never easy going through a breakup, but people change as they get older and mature, and they aren' t necessarily going to still be compatible the whole time. Also I think it' s important to not think of a relationship that peters out as a failed one. Just because it didn' t last until one of you died doesn' t mean it wasn' t a success. <s>Yeah, I mean it' s never easy going through a breakup, but people change as they get older and mature, and they aren' t necessarily going to still be compatible the whole time. Also I think it' s important to not think of a relationship that peters out as a failed one. Just because it didn' t last until one of you died doesn' t mean it wasn' t a success. I think people put too much emphasis on permanence.</s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s>

<s>It takes time to build friendships and relations. The best way to establish the connection is to find individuals who share similar interests with you. There is no harm to approach people and introduce yourself. Find some common interests by asking a few questions. If you like the individuals' personality and if they seem genuine then you can seek a stronger connection.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>It takes time to build friendships and relations. The best way to establish the connection is to find individuals who share similar interests with you. There is no harm to approach people and introduce yourself. Find some common interests by asking a few questions. If you like the individuals' personality and if they seem genuine then you can seek a stronger connection.</s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s>

[CLS]  ve been feeling really depressed and lethargic lately. the holidays feel like all work and no joy this year... it is hard being away from family.</s><s>Can you explain to me more in depth what events are making you feel this way?</s><s>the fact that there is a pandemic and travel is restricted, normally i would spend the holidays with my family but i will be alone this year. there is still a lot of work to do but it feels like there is nothing to look forward to.</s><s>I understand exactly how you feel since I am also unable to go fly out to see my family this Christmas. It sounds like you are very overwhelmed with the amount of work you have and having no break, correct?</s><s>it has been such a long year, i am just ready for things to improve. it is hard not having the usual coping mechanisms of socializing with friends or going out. yes, that is part of it. the work wouldn' t seem so bad if there was somethign to look forward to but every day feels the same.</s><s>When I start to feel alone and missing my family or friends, I usually like the plan a skype or group facetime session right after I get off of work.</s><s>i have tried to use zoom and facetime but video chat gives me anxiety.</s><s>There are online resources to have some fun with friends too - - many blogs suggest hosting a group game night or a shared movie night.</s><s>that does sound a little better. the winter makes it worse too, all the days are so dark and cold.</s><s>I am sure with a bit of trial and error, hosting a movie or game night would be a breeze for you too!</s><s>i wish that i could spend more time outside, over the summer and fall it helped to get more fresh air and exercise.</s><s>Having this winter sadness, especially around holiday times, may be a sign of seasonal depression.</s><s>i do usually experience depression in the winter and around the holidays. but the pandemic has made it harder to cope.</s><s>I have had seasonal depression in the past, and going on nature hikes and bike rides has helped me a lot. Maybe spending less time inside your home and grabbing some fresh air can relieve some of that anxiety and stress.</s><s>it hasn' t been too cold to go out... now that the days will start getting longer maybe there will be more time to get outside.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Research shows that physical activity greatly reduces stress! It sounds like going out more would be very beneficial to you!</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>

Right no w i feel like giving up.</s><s>For me, when I start getting overwhelmed and need to" debrief" my mind, and" declutter" the stresses, I use a notepad. I jot down every detail I can that pops into mind. Every upcoming task, everything that has caused anxiety or similar, and then I prioritize them in an agenda. It seems tedious, however once you get a handle on scheduling, in my personal ex perience, it is easier to hold yourself accountable and slowly work your way through accomplishments, even small tasks, which is encouraging to continue. Sometimes, something as small as an accomplished task can uplift a mood greatly. Especially when listed and checked off to see the progress.</s><s>Thank you. That seems helpful. I tend to make excuses for myself when I feel like this and allow myself to slip in other areas of my life. For example if I am stressed, I tend to eat unhealthy food. [CLS]  something you' ve felt on previous birthdays?</s><s>yes, the older I get the worse the feeling is. I didn' t used to hate birthdays when I was younger.</s><s>I' ll confess I have felt the same way, especially with" milestone" birthdays( 30, 40, 50, etc.). Do you think you are possibly expect too much in terms of achievements?</s><s>Yes, those are hard. My 30th was difficult. Society has so many wrong ideas of where people need to be, and it just doesn' t apply to me. I' m so different from normal people. maybe, but being autistic, even average achievements are hard for me. I have to work so hard just to be average. May I ask, how did you deal with your own birthday depression? Maybe I can learn from you.</s><s>As I became older, i started to wonder what terms like" normal people" and being" average" really mean. Am I comparing myself to something that even exists?</s><s>That' s what I' ve been thinking about too. It probably doesn' t exist, but society would have us believe otherwise.</s><s>That' s so true. It' s tough to deal with. But I will same, as I became older, I just stopped caring as much about what other' s think. It just happened.</s><s>Yep, it sure is. I figure people stop caring that much when they get older.</s><s>Also, I' m sure there are some things in life you are good at, even if those aren' t what society seems to value.</s><s>I' ve already stopped caring what people younger than me think. They just seem so young to me. yea, it' s just hard when I struggle so much with employment. My issues really keep me from succeeding in jobs. Sure, there are things I can do; but they don' t seem to help me with anything important in life, if you know what I mean.</s><s>Yeah, I hear you. <s>Okay gotcha. Well a couple tips I can offer you: If you do end up on probation, most courses offer a probation workshop you can go through. And if you graduate in June, it should finish in time for you! And I was also going to recommend taking fewer units. As much as it sucks, you can' t overwhelm yourself with work. You need to be able to have a healthy and happy life that is separate from school in order to preform your best. Dropping your minor may be what is best for not only your grades, but your mental health. I also recommend making an educational plan. Although it can seem scary and long to see your goals directly laid out in front of you, it really helps with motivation.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Okay gotcha. Well a couple tips I can offer you: If you do end up on probation, most courses offer a probation workshop you can go through. And if you graduate in June, it should finish in time for you! And I was also going to recommend taking fewer units. As much as it sucks, you can' t overwhelm yourself with work. You need to be able to have a healthy and happy life that is separate from school in order to preform your best. Dropping your minor may be what is best for not only your grades, but your mental health. I also recommend making an educational plan. Although it can seem scary and long to see your goals directly laid out in front of you, it really helps with motivation.</s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s>

<s>Self care is so important even when there isn' t a pandemic. It can help you connect with yourself and make you feel less overwhelmed and just give you YOU time. Some of my favorite ways to do this is listening to podcasts, meditating and focusing on my breathing, listening to music, and pamper myself with face masks etc. I suggest you practice self care starting once a week and work it up from there giving yourself at least an hour a day if you can.</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>Self care is so important even when there isn' t a pandemic. It can help you connect with yourself and make you feel less overwhelmed and just give you YOU time. Some of my favorite ways to do this is listening to podcasts, meditating and focusing on my breathing, listening to music, and pamper myself with face masks etc. I suggest you practice self care starting once a week and work it up from there giving yourself at least an hour a day if you can.</s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s><s>

[CLS] <s>It sounds like you have a full plate with the little one. I know a lot of people are fearful now, but rest assured, children are really resilient to disease. The CDC has not even one record of a healthy child dying. Can you still go to the park and let them run and play? I think it' s healthier to be around people then to isolate. That' s my personal observation. It' s really taking a toll on all of us emotionally to be distant. little ones...</s><s>For a few months I eased up and let them play at the park, but we live in MI which is having another huge spike, especially our county. Thank goodness we have a pretty large yard for them to run and play in but I also know its not the same.</s><s>One thing that comes to mind about your marriage is how I continued to work on myself, and surprisingly, some of the changes I made in myself helped my husband change. For example. I realized I didn' t speak respectfully to him all the time. So I changed my tone. Sometimes I didn' t FEEL respectful, but I read this book explaining how men really need that. So I changed me. And you know what, he really responded well to that. Became more kind and loving. I prayed a lot and that is one thing God showed me. I read a few books on what men were like and how I could help my marriage. My husband often oblivious, but when I worked on me and doing things that men like, he actually became a better man. Hard to explain. I would encourage you to write out some goals and things you want to change about yourself, ideas for you and your children to do. And fight the blues as hard as you can. I find that if I have a list of things I need to do, I can follow that even when I don' t feel like it, and sometimes I get out of the slump.</s><s>It makes total sense. I have tried to do some research and yes work on myself as well. I have done a ton of praying. I do need to make new goals. They help me stay on track, thats for sure. Of course now that I' m home schooling my oldest I' m tearing my hair out there as welll. lol! I always had a huge amount of respect for teachers, but wow!</s><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad><pad>
<s>It sounds like you do know good things to do, and that sometimes you need that encouragement and and support. Do you have friends maybe to check in with? Just to chat. I have been doing that myself. Just phoning people to connect. It has helped so much. Just to say hi and share my life. Life has a way of handing us curveballs. It upsets us then we don' t know what to do, we fall down and get in a slump. And I find that writing lists, making goals, calling friends, doing things differently, brainstorming solutions can help me get back on track.</s>
<s>It sounds like you do know good things to do, and that sometimes you need that encouragement and and support. Do you have friends maybe to check in with? Just to chat. I have been doing that myself. Just phoning people to connect. It has helped so much. Just to say hi and share my life. Life has a way of handing us curveballs. It upsets us then we don' t know what to do, we fall down and get in a slump. And I find that writing lists, making goals, calling friends, doing things differently, brainstorming solutions can help me get back on track.</s>
